skill.name: deploying-cloud-k8s
skill.description:
Deploys applications to cloud Kubernetes (AKS/GKE/DOKS) with CI/CD pipelines.
Use when deploying to production, setting up GitHub Actions, troubleshooting deployments.
Covers build-time vs runtime vars, architecture matching, and battle-tested debugging.

skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code paths. Contains only YAML configuration examples, infrastructure patterns, and a read-only verification script that validates its own structure. No network calls, no external filesystem access, no environment variable reading.

content.value_statement: Deploying applications to Kubernetes requires understanding build-time vs runtime variables, architecture matching, and CI/CD configuration. This skill provides battle-tested patterns for deploying to AKS, GKE, and DOKS with GitHub Actions and Helm.
actual_capabilities: Configure build-time vs runtime environment variables for Next.js
Match Docker build architecture to cluster (arm64 vs amd64)
Set up GitHub Actions CI/CD with selective builds using path filters
Deploy with Helm passing secrets securely via --set
Apply GitOps patterns with ArgoCD and Kustomize overlays
limitations: Does not provision Kubernetes clusters (use cloud provider tools)
Does not manage container registries or authentication
Does not include monitoring setup (references patterns only)
Requires existing kubectl access and cluster credentials

use_cases.title: Production Deployments
use_cases.description: Set up reliable CI/CD pipelines for deploying to cloud Kubernetes clusters with proper secret management

use_cases.title: Container Troubleshooting
use_cases.description: Diagnose and fix common deployment issues like architecture mismatches and image pull failures

use_cases.title: GitOps Configuration
use_cases.description: Implement GitOps workflows with ArgoCD, Kustomize overlays, and environment-specific configurations

prompt_templates.title: Quick Deploy
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my Next.js application to Azure Kubernetes Service using GitHub Actions. I need help with build args for NEXT_PUBLIC_* variables and Helm secret passing.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Image Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My pods are showing ImagePullBackOff with 'no match for platform' error. Help me diagnose and fix the architecture mismatch between my Docker builds and GKE cluster.

prompt_templates.title: Setup CI/CD
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up GitHub Actions workflow that only builds changed services (api or web) based on which files were modified. Include path filters and Docker build-push action.

prompt_templates.title: GitOps Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure ArgoCD Application with Kustomize overlays for a production deployment. Include sync policy with prune and self-heal enabled.

output_examples.input: Deploy my Next.js app to AKS with GitHub Actions
output: ✓ Build args: NEXT_PUBLIC_* variables must use ARG in Dockerfile
✓ GitHub Actions: Use docker/build-push-action@v5 with platforms: linux/arm64

best_practices: Always check cluster architecture before building images to avoid platform mismatch errors
Pass all secrets through Helm --set rather than embedding in values.yaml
Use build args (ARG) for NEXT_PUBLIC_* variables, not runtime ENV in Dockerfiles
anti_patterns: Embedding secrets in Docker images or values.yaml files
Building images without verifying cluster architecture (arm64 vs amd64)
Using runtime ENV for Next.js public variables that must be embedded at build time

faq.question: Which Kubernetes platforms are supported?
faq.answer: AKS (Azure), GKE (Google Cloud), and DOKS (DigitalOcean) are explicitly covered with platform-specific patterns.

faq.question: What architecture types can this skill handle?
faq.answer: Both arm64 and amd64 architectures are supported with guidance on matching Docker builds to cluster nodes.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with kubectl, GitHub Actions, Helm, Docker buildx, and ArgoCD for complete deployment workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation patterns. It does not access files, networks, or execute commands on your systems.

faq.question: Why is my pod showing ImagePullBackOff?
faq.answer: Common causes include wrong image tag, unauthorized registry access, or architecture mismatch. Run diagnostic commands to identify the specific error.

faq.question: How does this differ from containerizing-applications skill?
faq.answer: That skill focuses on building Docker images and Helm charts. This skill focuses on deploying those artifacts to cloud Kubernetes with CI/CD pipelines.
